de.teklic.mario.messanger

Class MessageWorker

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.teklic.mario.messanger.MessageWorker
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class MessageWorker
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    A MessageWorker is responsible for a MessageJob. It reruns a Job, based on the MessageJobs information. It also checks for conditions if a job has finished

        public static final java.util.logging.Logger logger

    • Constructor Detail

      • MessageWorker

        public MessageWorker(MessageJob messageJob)

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Runs in an extra thread and tries to send out a RouteX, based on the MessageJobs information. Checks several times (retries * 3) if condition matches. If so, the MessageWorker will stop his work. If not and all retries have been tried, the worker stops and makes other actions, based on which kind of RouteX instance it is.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • sleepAndCheck

        public boolean sleepAndCheck(java.lang.Integer times)
        Checks if cancellation condition have met. Example: An acknowledge has been registered after an message was sent out.
        Parameters:
        times - Retries to check for condition.
        Returns:
        true if MessageWorker can stop.

      • onSuccessfulPostExecutions

        public void onSuccessfulPostExecutions()
        Bases on the MessageJob's RouteX instance, other work will be done. Example: A Message must be sent to 0134. No Route for 0134 is stored. Make a RouteX.Request first. After a reply was registered, fire a new RouteX.Message Job to the Messenger. For this situation, the initial RouteX.Message must and can be stored inside of a RouteX.Request object.

      • onFailedPostExecutions

        public void onFailedPostExecutions()

      • sendError

        public void sendError()
        An error message gets created and gets sent out. The Error is based on the MessageJobs information.
